full_text:
That is why I use the natural trifield solely on a flat surface, typically
during a sit down EVP session, and never while moving.  They say you can use
it while moving but I would not trust any results.

The device on the webpage listed looks damn impressive.  Unfortunately I am
a electro-ignoramus, but reading the description of the device was quite
intriguing.  I cannot assemble such devices, but I can understand their use.
 This device appears to have a wonderful range of application.

Is there any video online of this device being used? My curiosity is piqued.

The natural trifield is woefully inadequate for paranormal research and
"real" meters are so damn expensive that I cannot justify spending the
monetary amount they command at the present time.

> The Trifield Natural EMF meter is not the same as the general Trifield
> meter. It is very sensitive to the Earth's magnetic field. It is in magnetic

> Moving too fast or turning causes the meter to flick. I have the knob for
> the audible beep trigger turned down most of the time because the constant
> beeps when I walk or turn get annoying.
>
> It is a TriFIELD meter, not a TriAXIS meter. I always assumed it had that
> name because it has settings to detect electric, magnetic and RF
> (electromagnetic) fields. Those are the three fields it is capable of
> detecting.
>

> anything you can buy commercially.

>>
>> This device is misused by almost everybody!  This is because the manual
>> sucks and the TV people use it wrong consistently.  To figure it out, I
>> contacted the manufacturer a couple years back and this is what they told
>> me.
>>
>> Always us the Trifield in Magnetic mode.  If the box is stable and there
>> is no lightning, the box should not sound an alarm unless something
>> paranormal is happening (or you move your digital recorder to close to it,
>> magnetized speakers).  If you use electric or combination, you can, and
>> will, pick up the body electric with every motion and may receive many false
>> positives.  The meter should also never be used while walking because this
>> too gives unreliable readings.  There is nothing worse than seeing some TV
>> schmuck holding it in their hands and claiming something paranormal is going
>> on because an alarm is sounding, never mind that the camera is right next to
>> it emitting magnetism through the mic / internal speaker.
>>
>> Also, the name trifield is a misnomer.  It only has one plane of reading,
>> not three!  The yellow one (AC) has three fields.  The natural trifield only
>> measures the plane that extends from the top and bottom edges lengthwise
>> from the devices.  So if you have the device sitting upright, you will only
>> measure whatever is above the device.  If you have it laying flat, you will
>> be able to measure the full plane of length extending beyond the bottom and
>> top edges.  Therefore, it is best to use this device slightly elevated and
>> laying flat.
>>
>> Using it in this fashion has yielded some amazing results thus far.  While
>> it is rare for this meter to fire when used properly, when a "spirit"
>> understands how to trigger the alarm you can get conversations that can last
>> upwards of an hour.  I have experiences this only 6 times in all the years I
>> have investigated.  Most of the time, this device yields a single alarm, or
>> maybe two, with no real time interaction with questions.
>>
